semantics.ranking

Class SystemZ

  • Object
    • SystemZ

  • public class SystemZ
extends Object
    System Z calculates a unique minimal ranking function for a propositional conditional knowledge base. The set of conditionals is partitioned into an ordered set of sets of conditionals, each of it consisting of the conditionals that are tolerated by all conditionals within the same and the following sets. A conditional is tolerated by a set of conditionals if there is a possible world in which it is verified and none of the other conditionals if falsified. If the knowledge base is consistent, such a partitioning exists.
    Author:
    Tobias Falke

    • Constructor Detail

      • SystemZ

        public SystemZ(Collection<Conditional<PropositionalVariable>> knowledgeBase)
        Creates a new instance of System Z for the given knowledge base. Possible worlds will be derived, the conditionals partitioned and the minimal ranking function will be calculated.
        Parameters:
        knowledgeBase - Knowledge base

        public boolean isConsistent()
        Returns whether the knowledge base is consistent or not.
        Returns:
        true, if the knowledge base is consistent, false otherwise

      • isTolerated

        private boolean isTolerated(Conditional<PropositionalVariable> c,
                  Collection<Conditional<PropositionalVariable>> kb)
        Check whether a conditional is tolerated by a set of conditionals (a knowledge base), which is the case if there is a possible world in which the conditional is verified and in which no conditional of the knowledge base is falsified.
        Parameters:
        c - Conditional
        kb - Knowledge base
        Returns:
        true, if the conditional is verified, false otherwise
